Title: Resurfacing of 2 Christchurch Play Parks
Description: Christchurch Borough Council need to procure Safety Surfacing for two play areas within the Borough. Watermans Toddler Play Area needs a Wet Pour surfacing overlay and Knapp Mill Play Area needs a Tiger Mulch or Rubber Mulch equivalent surface and sub-base. The surfacing across both sites within the safety areas must comply with BS EN 1176 and the surfacing must be tested in accordance with BS EN 1177, EN1177 and be independently certified.
Additional Text:
Suppliers interested in this contract opportunity can access the full procurement documentation by visiting Bournemouth Borough Council's electronic Tendering system www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk

Suppliers should search for the contract opportunity through Supplying the South West. There are further details of the contract opportunity on the advert published on www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk and instructions on how suppliers can access the procurement documentation for completion. 

Responses to the contract opportunity must be submitted electronically through www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk before the deadline shown on the system. 

If you are unable to access the advert for the opportunity through www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk please contact the Council using the contact details provided.

Title: Play Area Surfacing Multi Supplier Framework
Description:
Chelmsford City Council is seeking to appoint a small number of appropriately qualified and experienced contractors to a multi supplier framework for the provision of play area surfacing works. Selection to the framework will be on the basis of two priced projects, and all subsequent call offs from the framework will be subject to mini competitions. The duration of the Framework will be for the period 1st May 2018 - 30th April 2022.
      
      Details can be obtained at http://www.delta-esourcing.com/tenders/UK-title/Y9AK8W7A5X

Title: 9714 - Improvements to the play area and associated works at Mile Cross gardens in Norwich
Description:
Mile Cross Gardens are grade II listed parks; they are an integral feature of the Mile Cross housing development. The two linked parks were designed in the 1920s to provide green space and recreational opportunities for residents. They were originally laid out as bowling greens and each park has a classical pavilion building that served as the bowl pavilion.
       
      This project covers improving the condition of the gardens along with improving the play value of the green space and enhancing access to the sites for visitors / users. 
      In recent years the parks have become underused and the fabric of the original design including pergola features, stone walling and the original pavilion buildings have either been removed (in the case of the pergolas) or damaged and becoming costly and difficult to maintain. There are limited play facilities (play equipment) in the northern of the two parks. The simple layout and style of the parks has ensured that they remain an attractive asset to the area but investment is required to ensure they continue to serve the needs of the local community.
      
      Norwich City Council is seeking a supplier to complete the required improvements and associated works. 
      This project proposal is for the:-
      • removal of two swing sets 
      •supply and installation of new play equipment 
      •installation of seating and picnic benches
      •replacement access steps 
      •installation of a new access gate 
      •slimblock grass grid to damaged grass surfacing
      •preparing the site for installation of safety surfacing by DCM surfacing.
      
      The Gardens are adjacent to and accessible from Suckling Avenue, Mile Cross, Norwich NR3 2RS.
